heading: passage: otto bettmann, 94
subheading: fired from a job in germany in 1933, he left the reich with nothing but two steamer trunks full of photographs. the pictures became the nucleus of what, by consensus, became the most complete image library of the 20th century world. in 1995, the bettmann archive -- which through licensing brought a fortune to its founder -- was acquired by corbis, a firm owned by bill gates.
author: wired staff
